snippet: As Bank of America and the insurer MBIA continue to battle over claims left over from the financial crisis, the lawyers are doing well, but those who suffered in the crisis are not.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column analyzes complex legal battle between Bank of America and monoline insurer MBIA, which may face bankruptcy for insuring toxic mortgages sold by Countrywide Financial; points out Bank of America purchased Countrywide in the lead up to the financial crisis; expresses frustration that so much money is likely to go to lawyers rather than those who were deceived by the transactions.
lead_paragraph: As Bank of America and the insurer MBIA continue to battle over claims left over from the financial crisis, the lawyers are doing well, but those who suffered in the crisis are not.

headline.print_headline: As the Crisis Is Revisited, Lawyers Win
headline.seo: Bank of America and MBIA Revisit the Mortgage Debacle
headline.main: As the Crisis Is Revisited, Lawyers Win
